data.current_description: Use this endpoint to uninstall your app from a customer's HubSpot account. If successful, this endpoint will return a 204 and the customer will receive an email notification that the developer has uninstall the app from their account.
data.summary_suggestion: Uninstall app from customer HubSpot account
data.description_suggestion: Removes your app from a customer's HubSpot account. This operation requires authentication and the customer's account identifier. On successful completion, returns HTTP 204 No Content and triggers an email notification to the customer informing them that the developer has uninstalled the app. This action is permanent and will revoke all app permissions and access to the customer's account data.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't specify the scope (customer account). Description has a typo ('uninstall' should be 'uninstalled') and lacks critical details about required inputs, authentication, and permanent side effects. Enhanced version clarifies what inputs are needed, specifies the HTTP response code, explains the notification behavior, and emphasizes the permanent nature of the action for better AI agent decision-making about when to invoke this destructive operation.
